question.title: MaterialSwitch inside CardView resets value after re-entering fragment
question.body:
I have some Java code that dynamically creates a CardView with a MaterialSwitch inside of it. After re-entering (opening another one, then entering back) the fragment, all the dynamically created switches are set to on or off. here is the code for the layout used for this

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.cardview.widget.CardView
    xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="wrap_content"
    android:layout_margin="8dp"
    android:backgroundTint="@color/normal_window"
    app:cardElevation="4dp"
    app:cardCornerRadius="8dp"
    android:saveEnabled="true">

    <LinearLayout
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:orientation="vertical"
        android:padding="16dp">

        <LinearLayout
            android:layout_width="match_parent"
            android:layout_height="wrap_content"
            android:orientation="horizontal"
            android:gravity="center_vertical">

            <TextView
                android:id="@+id/list_name"
                android:layout_width="0dp"
                android:layout_height="wrap_content"
                android:layout_weight="1"
                android:textSize="16sp"
                android:textStyle="bold"/>

            <com.google.android.material.switchmaterial.SwitchMaterial
                android:id="@+id/list_switch"
                android:layout_width="wrap_content"
                android:layout_height="wrap_content"
                style="@style/Custom.Switch"
                android:saveEnabled="true"
                />
        </LinearLayout>
        <Button
            android:id="@+id/action_button"
            android:layout_width="wrap_content"
            android:layout_height="wrap_content"
            android:layout_marginTop="8dp"
            android:text="@string/btn_delete"
            app:icon="@drawable/ic_delete_24dp"
            android:drawablePadding="4dp"/>

    </LinearLayout>

</androidx.cardview.widget.CardView>

and a part of fragment code (onCreate)

LinearLayout listLayout = root.findViewById(R.id.listlayout);                          

CardView cardView = (CardView) LayoutInflater.from(root.getContext()).inflate(R.layout.item_list_card, listLayout, false);
TextView listName = cardView.findViewById(R.id.list_name);
SwitchMaterial switchMaterial = cardView.findViewById(R.id.list_switch);
Button actionButton = cardView.findViewById(R.id.action_button);

...

listLayout.addView(cardView);
